Question:
Here is a dataset in the form of (x, y) coordinates. P1 = (1, 1), P2 = (6, 6), P3 = (4, 6), P4 = (6, 4) and the seperator is a line at y = 3.5. Let our objective be the regularized average hinge loss with respect to $\gamma_{\text {ref }}$ :
$$
J\left(\theta, \theta_{0}, \gamma_{\text {ref }}\right)=\frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} L_{H}\left(\frac{\gamma\left(x, y, \theta, \theta_{0}\right)}{\gamma_{\text {ref }}}\right)+\lambda \frac{1}{\gamma_{\text {ref }}^{2}}
$$
If $\lambda=0$, and we're still referring to the separator at y=3.5, what range of values of $\gamma_{\text {ref }}$ achieves the optimal value of $J$?
